main.div: Granite School District > Granite News > COVID-19

article.class: post-15546 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-covid-19 entry

div.p: Granite School District has designated a portion of our school bus fleet to serve as Wi-Fi hotspots for students during the dismissal. These specially configured buses will be parked in various high density residential locations throughout the district from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. on school days to boost ...

article.class: post-15539 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-covid-19 entry

img.alt: Girl typing on laptop and text '4th Quarter Grading'

div.p:
State officials have announced the continuation of distance learning through the end of the school year. In conjunction with Utah State Board of Education guidance, the following grading practices will be implemented in Granite School District for the 4th quarter.
For the remainder of the school ...

article.class: post-15526 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-covid-19 entry

header.h2: Meal Service Change for Cottonwood Elementary

div.p: Due to some abatement work, meal service at Cottonwood Elementary School will close on Friday, April 17 and will be transferred to Olympus Jr High beginning Monday, April 20. ...

div.a: Read Meal Service Change for Cottonwood Elementary

article.class: post-15524 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-covid-19 entry

header.h2: Student Dismissal Extended Through End of School Year

div.p:
Governor Gary Herbert and state superintendent Syd Dickson have announced that public schools in Utah will extend the student dismissal through the end of the school year.
This means students will not be returning to school until at least the fall for the 2020-2021 school year. The district is ...

div.a: Read Student Dismissal Extended Through End of School Year

article.class: post-15508 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-covid-19 entry

div.p:
Nutrition staff members are delighted to serve meals and provide some consistency in a time of uncertainty. To see students' smiling faces and have even a small moment of interaction has been a highlight for employees.
Due to Stay-at-Home restrictions, we must further change our operations to ...

article.class: post-15497 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-covid-19 entry

img.alt: Graphic of woman sitting on couch with checklist

div.p:
Physical distancing and stay-at-home recommendations have been in place for several weeks now, but it's never too late to establish beneficial routines and evaluate your well-being.
Self-care is any activity that we do deliberately in order to take care of our mental, emotional, and physical ...

article.class: post-15457 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-covid-19 entry

img.alt: Vector image of face mask instruction

div.p: Granite School District nurses are working closely with the Salt Lake County Health Department to ensure our students, families and employees have the best information to stay safe and healthy. Recently released information includes a recommendation to use a face covering while in public. This is ...

article.class: post-15450 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-covid-19 entry

img.alt: Kindergarten students lined up next to a smart board and text 'Kindergarten Registration'

div.p:
Do you have a kindergarten-age child who will be attending school next year (5 years old on or before September 1)? You can begin the kindergarten registration process for the 2020-2021 school year:
View the kindergarten registration page to begin the registration process ...

article.class: post-15445 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-covid-19 tag-act tag-act-test tag-delay tag-schedule tag-testing entry

header.h2: Vouchers for ACT Dates in Summer, Fall

div.p:
Current 11th grade students in Granite School District will be given vouchers from American College Testing (ACT) to register to take the ACT assessment later this year at no additional cost.
The first set of test vouchers will be sent the third week of April. When a student receives their ...

div.a: Read Vouchers for ACT Dates in Summer, Fall

span.span: Tagged With: act, act test, delay, schedule, testing

article.class: post-15427 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-covid-19 entry

div.p:
Dear Granite District Patrons and Employees,
As many of you may have heard, the Governor has initiated some additional guidance as of 4 p.m. (Friday, March 27, 2020) this afternoon. Full details of this directive can be found at https://coronavirus.utah.gov/latest/.
Some of this new guidance ...
We value your feedback. Please take a short survey and let us know how we're doing.
Receive the latest Granite School District happenings in your inbox.

div.div:
Intranet ·
Privacy Policy · Terms of Use · F.A.Q. · Login

div.p:
Granite School District prohibits discrimination, harassment (including sexual harassment), or retaliation on the basis of race, color, sex, pregnancy, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other legally protected classification in all educational programs, activities, admissions, access, treatment, or employment practices and provides equal access to scouting groups and other designated youth groups. Related inquiries and complaints may be directed to a school administrator or to Charlene Lui, Title IX Coordinator and Director of Educational Equity, (385) 646-7413. You may also contact the Office for Civil Rights, Denver, CO, (303) 844-5695.
» Read Policy «

The Granite School District is committed to making our content accessible to all members of the public and district, including those with disabilities. If this applies to you, and you would like to provide feedback or report a concern, please contact our Communications Office.
The Granite School District is not responsible for the text and content of websites not owned and operated by the Granite School District.
